data.title: Hal Lanier named manager of Sussex Skyhawks
data.meta_description: Former Major League Baseball player and manager Hal Lanier has been named manager of the Sussex Skyhawks minor league baseball team in Frankford, Sussex County. Lanier, who spent 10 seasons in the big leagues as a player, including eight with...
data.text:
Former Major League Baseball player and manager Hal Lanier has been named manager of the Sussex Skyhawks minor league baseball team in Frankford, Sussex County.

Lanier, who spent 10 seasons in the big leagues as a player, including eight with the San Francisco Giants and two with the Yankees, replaces Brian Drahman, who had managed the in its first two seasons.

As a coach, Lanier spent five seasons in the St. Louis Cardinals organization, first as a minor league manager and then as the third base coach for the 1982 World Series champs and the 1985 National League championship team.

In 1986, Lanier managed the Houston Astros and was named the National League Manager of the Year. He spent the past 12 seasons in independent baseball, including 10 with the Winnipeg Goldeyes and two with the Joliet Jackhammers, both in the Northern League.

The Skyhawks are a Can-Am League team at Skylands Park in Frankford, the former home of the defunct New Jersey Cardinals. The Skyhawks are owned by the same firm that owns the New Jersey Jackals of Montclair that also is in the Can-Am League.

Lanier is the second member of the 1982 World Champion St. Louis Cardinals coaching staff to be part of the management team at Skylands Park. Hub Kittle was the pitching coach for the 1982 St. Louis Cardinals team and joined the former New Jersey Cardinals staff in 1995.

The Skyhawks 2008 season kicks off on May 22.
